dict.string: THE GLOW OF THE ETERNAL STAR
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
"I'll let you pass if you tell me a funny word!"
"Not. Funny. At. All. Now I am angry..."
"You won't like me when I'm angry!"
"I'll only let you pass if you hand over all your MoonRocks!"
"Wow, thanks! This is just what I needed!"
"This is not what I asked for!"
"Umm... let me guess, you want something?"
"That's right. I am looking for a mysterious relic with an inscription that contains the words THE ETERNAL STAR. Do you have such a relic?"
"Please go right ahead, there is something of greater value if you continue further."
"This isn't it. This is an ETERNAL FAILURE!"
"I'm afraid you cannot pass, you'll be stuck here forever."
"What will it take to let me pass?"
"I'm not like the other aliens. How about your least valuable item?"
"Yeah... this looks cheap. That's just my style."
"Yes! I can see something in the distance!"
"I wanted something cheap... but instead you played a cheap trick!"
"Can I pass? I just need to go a little further..."
"You can pass, but only if you can answer my tricky problem!"
"Here's the problem... if I give you a group of three strings, can you tell me if the third string is a valid shuffle of the first two?"
"A valid shuffle combines two strings together where the left-to-right order of the characters in both strings is maintained."
"For example, if I give you ("ab", "cd", "cabd"), then "cabd" is a valid shuffle because characters "ab" and "cd" still occur in the same order."
"However, if I give you ("ab", "cd", "bacd"), then "bacd" IS NOT a valid shuffle because characters "ab" don't occur in the same order."
"Alright, I can do it. Give me a group of strings!"
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
"Hello, little robot. What brings you to my planet?"
"That's fine, but before I can let you look for treasure, I need any items you have from the planet Glinda."
"I can't trust you. I'm calling the reinforcements!"
"I've been looking for an ancient item. The oldest artifact from the planet Cunia."
"Can I take a look at the oldest item you have from Cunia?"
"Wow. Very interesting. Thanks for letting me see this."
"Now, as you requested, you may pass."
"Are you kidding me? What's that sticking out of your compartment?"
"Uhh... I don't know what you're talking about..."
"Something is fishy. I am going to keep you here until further notice."
"I'm doing alright, but I could use some help. They've asked me to step up security along this path."
"I guess I could help. What do you need?"
"I'm trying to crack a code that is being used by interplanetary pirates."
"They've been encrypting their messages using a number between 0 and 255."
"I'm just not sure which number it is... but I do know this encrypted message means "udacity"!"
"Heh. Yeah, I'm pretty good with encryption. Not because I'm a pirate or anything..."
"Aww man... it isn't working. Wait a minute!"
"How do I know you're not a pirate?!?"
"I need a quick way to report the rarity of items."
"I want to know how many common, uncommon, rare, and legendary items are in an inventory."
"If it gets me closer to some treasure, then why not? Let me think..."
"That's awesome! I really like that approach.
"This is going to cause seriously delays."
"I'm sorry. I can't let you pass until I figure this out."
"Since you know so much about rarity... could you quickly determine if one item is more valuable than another?"
"And I don't just mean by an item's value. An item should be more valuable if it is more rare than another item."
"But... if they have the same rarity, then compare their base values."
"You're right. I would have never thought of that!"
"Yeah, it is pretty elegant when you think about it."
"This is so great. Please go ahead, I'm sorry for the delay!"
"That won't work. I've tried it already and it failed."
"Until I figure this out, I can't let you pass. Those are direct orders!"
"Ooo... a traveler. I could use your help."
"I'm having trouble reading this list of items. Some of them need to be banned from this planet."
"Could you look through the list and tell me items that mention a "laser" and are less than 30 carbon years old?"
"There is a recall on such items, and I need to get rid of them."
"Hmm... I'm not sure about this. I think I need a second opinion."
"I'll have another alien handle my watch. You'll need to wait here."
"I think I have something that could help you."
"It is a list of planets and information about the items detected on their surfaces."
"I'll let you have it if you tell me the planet that has the most intriguing items."
"Interesting. Maybe I'll plan my next visit there."
"That isn't what the last robot told me."
"I think I'll have you wait here until someone comes along and gives us another opinion."
"Please tell me you're the last alien on this path."
"You've got it. And I will let you pass if you can answer my question."
"If you take the names of all the items in your inventory... what is the most common character?"
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
"In a second, but first you need to pass a basic check."
"To pass, all you have to do is get someone to tap the screen."
"Hey! Anybody out there? Will you please tap the screen?"
"Nice! Here, take a badge for this basic check."
"I'm not sure how you could have failed this..."
"You made it past the first basic check, but how about one more?"
"I hope so... Is there anyone out there?"
"You did it again! You must be quite persuasive!"
"I'm not sure how you could have failed this..."
"This time, I will do a more advanced check!"
"Well... actually I'm just kidding. It is the same as the basic check. Someone just needs to tap the screen again..."
"BUT, if you can pass this check, then I'll give you another badge for an "advanced check" because of the trouble I'm causing you."
"I can do it. I have faith in the people beyond the screen!"
"I'm not sure how you could have failed this..."
"I'm stopping! I'm stopping! I'm just a friendly robot trying to pass through. What's going on here?"
"I'm on expert check duty, and I'm afraid you'll have to pass an expert check or I'll hand you over to the alien authorities."
"What's an expert check? I'll do it."
"Uhh... well actually I'm not quite sure. Most of the time when I say "expert check" everyone goes away."
"How about you let me pass if I can convince someone to tap the screen?"
"What?!? You know how to communicate with those from across the screen? Incredible!"
"Sure. Absolutely. If someone taps the screen, then you can be on your way."
"Hello, world! Is there anybody out there? Will someone please tap the screen?"
"Here's your expert badge, but watch out for the alien at the end of this pass. You'll need all of your badges to get through!"
"I'm not sure how you could have failed this..."
"I'm afraid I can only let you pass if you have the proper badges."
"Badges... I have plenty of those. Which ones are you talking about?"
"Well... here is my list. It says I need to see badges for two basic checks, an advanced check, and an expert check."
"Yeah I can check if have those... somebody just needs to tap the screen."
"As much as I want to detain you, I guess I'll have to let you through."
"That's it! I've had enough of the shenanigans!"
"You're coming with me to the alien authorities!"
Hero: "Hey friend! Will you help me explore this strange planet?"
"I've made it this far... how can I pass?"
"I'll make it easy for you. Here is a method I use to ensure no prohibited items pass through on my watch."
"You can use it to check how many prohibited items are in an inventory by looking at the errors it throws."
"When the method throws an errors, that means a prohibited item was found."
"If you report all the errors to me, then I'll be nice to you. But if not, there's no guarantees."
"Hmm... I don't think your being completely honest with me. I can't let you pass."
"I need a new, more simple method."
"It should return true if an item contains the word "laser" in its name."
"Things are well. But I need some help."
"The alien you just passed gave you a method for checking prohibited items, right?"
"Well... I need you to make me a method for doing the same thing."
"The method should check items in the following order..."
"First, if the item's name contains "laser", then throw an error."
"Second, if the item is from Cunia, then throw an error."
"Last, if the item has a base value of less than 10, then throw an error."
"Make sure you check the items in this order!"
"Oh no... this isn't going to work. It doesn't pass my command's acceptance test."
"I'm going to have to keep you here until we figure it out."
"I hope you're ready for some fun."
"I'll let you pass if you can complete four tasks."
"What's fun about four tasks? That sounds like a lot of work. There must be some catch."
"There is a catch. If you're clever, each task can be solved in just one line of code!"
"But... even if you use more than one line of code, I'll let you pass as long as each solution works."
"ALSO, if your solutions do not use either the map, sort, filter, or reduce method, then we may have problems later!"
"I'm ready for this. What's the first task?"
"For each item in your inventory, add 100 to its base value."
"That doesn't work. So I can't let you pass."
"I want you to sort the items in your inventory."
"Great question. I want them sorted in a special manner."
"An item should be considered less than another item if it is less rare."
"But, if an item has the same rarity as another item, then you should check to see which item has a lower base value."
"That doesn't work. So I can't let you pass."
"I want you to show me how to reduce an inventory to only the items that are common."
"That doesn't work. So I can't let you pass."
"I want you to tell me what the combined base value is for all your items."
"Since you completed all four tasks, you may pass!"
"That doesn't work. So I can't let you pass."
"It is I! The robot you've heard so much about!"
"Indeed. Your reputation proceeds you, but you must still fulfill one final request before you can pass."
"This request will test your wits! Use any means necessary to fulfill it!"
"I can do it! What's the request?"
"I need you to remove all the duplicates items from an inventory."
"You're so close, but I cannot let you pass."
